node.text: Blue sky here or there, blue skies everywhere!! A mantra and a spell for you Happy Birthday @nicoletta_fiorucci_london üßöüèªü§ç

About last night, and the following morning. As Janus, one looks forward to the future, while the other carries the sign of what has been and no longer is. ‚ÄúWho is the older Sister?‚Äù, I would ask to Giacomo Leopardi, ‚ÄúFashion or Death?‚Äù Thxs @fabio_donofrio , photo on the back by @alessandro_di_giampietro

Epifania, (from the Greek ·ºêœÄŒπœÜŒ¨ŒΩŒµŒπŒ±, epif√°neia) by lexical corruption through bifan√¨a and befan√¨a, here it comes the Befana. 
In my hometown/village, Borgonovo V.T, who recently elected me man of the year 2019 on December 23th (with a very short coronation), the puppet of the old lady on the broom was put on fire precisely on this day (or for the last day of carnival ?)
My warmest and best wishes to all my girls, witchy friends, old and new, known and unknown, for a hot and sparkling new decade. In the meanwhile, I get on my broom - as always out of gas - and fly to S√£o Paulo.
Who wore it best ?
Bye bye London, catch you later

3 is a recurrent number. From 3 Spear Mews, the most secret door I ever entered, to flat 3 the new glowing venue of the @fiorucciartrust at 8 Chelsea Embankment. As a Mercury, I will stay in-between - in the wavy King‚Äôs Road. On my way to work I will keep crossing the places where great authors lived. How will all of this echo in my future narratives?

Last days in Spear Mews, last days in the gracious company of ‚ÄòWe do not work alone‚Äô, an immersive intervention by Portuguese artist Joana Escoval. Interconnectivity is the key word. No separation! Here I‚Äôm wearing a shepherd‚Äôs natural rain coat (cro√ßa) that kept me protected from the elements during all 2019, made by Joana together with a Tr√°s-os-Montes artisan. 
Please join us tonight @fiorucciartrust, 6-9 pm, for our House Cooling. üì∏ @felipedmab #joanaescoval

Sunday in Venice. The last day of the week and the day after the end of my Italian Pavilion. The challenge to the Labyrinth is ready to retreat into the abstract realm of the soul. My title too has expired. The city is silent, still. The waters rippling. Dusk has fallen. It is time for one last drink. My thank you list is long and heartfelt. I will unfold it as gracefully as possible.

First of all, thank you to the protagonists of #NeitherNor: #ChiaraFumai, #EnricoDavid and #LilianaMoro. No exhibition would exist without artists.

Thank you to our Main Donor #NicolettaFiorucci @nicoletta_fiorucci_london; Main Sponsors @gucci and @fptindustrial; Technical Sponsors @gemmo, @selectaperitivo and C&C Milano. Thank you Spada Partners for you generous support and to Oliver & Mala Haarmann; Rika & Dirk Hamann, Berlin; Maja Hoffmann; Studio Legale Giuseppe Iannaccone e Associati; Emmy & Danny Lipschutz Tawil; Frances Reynolds for Instituto Inclusartiz; Muriel & Freddy Salem; Andrea & Francesca Viliani; Gino & Antonella Viliani. Further funding was also provided by Fabio Cherstich; Nadia & Rajeeb Samdani; Antonio & Carla Sersale.

Thank you Valerio Di Lucente @studio_julia for the exquisite exhibition design. @giovannamuzzisilva and @humboldtbooks who published the catalogue and my Press Office @pcm.studio.

Last but not least, I would like to invite my caryatids Scylla and Charybdis to join me for this aperitivo. Thank you for your invaluable help, Associate Curator @stellabottai and Research Curator @lavinia.filippi, other than my valiant Production Coordinator #GiorgiaGallina. You know my culinary skills are in the making, so let‚Äôs drop the food and toast together to this extraordinary experience! I hope you‚Äôll like my little cocktail. 
This is also my last post in collaboration with international befana and the 2019 Italian Pavilion‚Äôs Social Media Poet @matildecerrutiquara, who was in residence here duetting with me for the past seven months. Starting tomorrow, my account returns a personal business!! What more to say?
All‚Äôs well what ends well‚Ä¶ Addio Venezia! @labiennale @dg_aap üì∏ @giovannamuzzisilva in her grandmother‚Äôs Milanese kitchen dressed in @gucci

While lost in the mist of the Venetian Laguna earlier on today I took sometime to think about those whose presence has been essential, not only in the past seven months but well before. 
There are million words I could dedicate to you, my dearest Nicoletta @nicoletta_fiorucci_london. As many as all the adventures, extravaganzas, conversations and inspiring moments that have been filling our professional and personal journey of over ten years. But I will try to be minimal‚Äîfor once! 
When we started the @fiorucciartrust together, amidst your various activities as a patron, we set a seed for something bigger to grow. That is, an open vision. An ongoing relationship of exchange and creation. Thank you for your incredible support, soul generosity and friendship. For having been the Main Donor of the Italian Pavilion 2019 @labiennale and as always the first enthusiast, holding our spirits and contributing to #NeitherNor in all possible ways. 
#padiglioneitalia #italianpavilion #padiglioneitalia2019 #biennalearte2019 #enricodavid #chiarafumai #lilianamoro #neithernor #thechallengetothelabyrinth @labiennale @dg_aap

ELECTRIC SUNFLOWERS. The words dedicated to me by beloved writer @isabella_santacroce in a recent correspondence of ours. A psychedelic aura, the enigma of a gaze veiled by a mask. What hides below the surface? What crawls in the underground of existence? When I was 23, while studying the work of Italo Calvino I also came across Isabella‚Äôs book ‚ÄòDestroy‚Äô in my other readings. A journey of transcendence and entanglements, a burning flow of consciousness touching the heights of heaven and the depths of hell. It felt natural to invite her to manifest her precious and inspiring presence and be somehow involved within #NeitherNor. Thank you Isabella for the honour of your presence tonight and for your creative generosity. Be connected on my live stories tonight to follow her performance! üåπüì∏ courtesy of Isabella Santacroce

TONIGHT at Sala Cesetti, Bauer Hotel in Venice, 8 pm, artist and filmmaker #AnnaFranceschini @a_cinema_verite_kind_of_girl will premiere her short-duration moving image ‚ÄòBustrofedico‚Äô specially commissioned by the Italian Pavillion at the 58th @labiennale and produced by @inbetweenartfilm and @gluck50_milano üé• Reanimating and activating the space, sinuously unfolding around and about #NeitherNor, bringing the environments from death to life and back again from life to death throughout charming yet ephemeral and phantasmagorical presences, Anna embraced the challenge of answering the question‚ÄîHow can one create a labyrinthine film? The response shall be revealed. üì∏ Anna Franceschini, BUSTROFEDICO, video, color-sound, 14‚Äô 47‚Äô‚Äô, 2019, N√© altra N√© questa: La sfida al Labirinto, Padiglione Italia alla Biennale Arte 2019, Courtesy: MiBACT - Direzione Generale Creativit√† contemporanea e Rigenerazione urbana

(4, 5) Group of sculptures, both ‚ÄôUntitled‚Äô by #EnricoDavid. Two corresponding sculptures are placed as each inhabiting the other side of a mirror. A drill has sprouted in the genital area of one of the creatures: an uncanny extension, or a prolapse perhaps, a sprout of the vertebral column that gives it stability. Or could it even be a tool, an escamotage, a deus-ex-machina to perforate the glass and run away from its reality? On the opposite side, exhausted yet restless, half asleep and half awake, a sculpture with an unsteady posture leans against the wall in precarious balance, absorbed in its own synesthesia, listening to the matter that is hidden beyond the visible. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
(6) ‚ÄôSalti‚Äô (Jumps) by #LilianaMoro. Three closed-circuit slot car tracks intertwined with drawings form a figure of eight, or the infinite; a M√∂bius strip; an oval. A perpetual, eternal wandering with no way out that is implicitly accompanied by the suggestion of an incessant sound: ‚Äòvroom, vroom‚Äô‚Ä¶ the only exit could be a definitive one, an extreme. A leap out of the circuit, a cut off the beaten track. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Neither Nor: The challenge to the Labyrinth
Italian Pavilion
58th International Art Exhibition - La Biennale di Venezia 
Photography Delfino Sisto Legnani and Marco Cappelletti
Courtesy DGAAP-MiBAC ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
#padiglioneitalia #italianpavilion #padiglioneitalia2019 #biennalearte2019 #enricodavid #chiarafumai #lilianamoro #neithernor #thechallengetothelabyrinth @labiennale @dg_aap

This is the final countdown! And these are the last five works we shall disclose, just before the labyrinth seals back its mysteries into its mysticism, unruffled. You may look at this sequence as a last omen, a final reading. Cards crossing destinies and vice versa. Remember the transit is above and beyond, besides and below. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
(1) Œë ŒΩ Œµ Œº Œø œÇ (Anemos) by #LilianaMoro. A silver-glazed ceramic hound is looking down at a leaf dropped, tensing its muscles to maintain a precarious balance on the metal slide it lives on, striving to recover the precious treasure lost, in vain. A reflection on the unescapable volatility of social values and on the natural resistance that occurs therein. In ancient Greek, Œë ŒΩ Œµ Œº Œø œÇ means ‚Äòwind‚Äô, ‚Äòwhirl‚Äô, ‚Äòpassion‚Äô‚Ä¶ ‚Äòinstability‚Äô. The work and the word hence immortalise a moment of rise and fall, the loss after the catch. The impetuous tension before the inevitable release. (2) ‚ÄòAutoparent‚Äô by #EnricoDavid. Silent, this pitch-black Junoesque body has been resting diagonally like a beam on the side walls, trapped by its enormous weight, stuck, unable to engage in much further action. Or perhaps it was so intent in the pursue of a relaxed levitation that nothing else really mattered. This caryatid is there like a sentinel of times, signalling an incumbent crossing but also potentially offering an element of support. (3) ‚ÄòLa Passeggiata‚Äô (The Walk) by #LilianaMoro. 35 couple of twins, iron shaped as roller-skates, tip-toeing a dance on wheels, were tied to each other for a lifelong procession. One of Liliana‚Äôs earliest works, it was created for a public park in Novi Ligure (Alessandria, Italy), which was split in two by a long avenue known as la passeggiata, where people of all ages strolled up and down. Chained together, scattered but united, the skates symbolise the incessant existential quest of the human being. A shared promenade, fragmented in solitude. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Neither Nor: The challenge to the Labyrinth

Courtesy DGAAP-MiBAC

Vampiresque. A living homage to Dracula, forever suspended in a state of stasis that neither belongs to the living, nor to the dead. As the last days of #NeitherNor are rolling by I find myself reflecting on the transient nature of life, mirrored by the Pavilion. How often things run in front of us without us taking the time to fully experience them, to savour the moment. Going throughout my scrapbook of memories and images from this journey, I found this favourite photo of mine from @dustmagazine coverage. It brought me back to the meaningful encounter with the great #CatherineOpie @csopie, who I had the honour to be photographed by in Los Angeles. The state of transit is one of crossing boundaries, of exploration and movement. And within movement there is always hope. Clothes by @gucci FW 19/20 special thanks to @alessandro_michele 
#padiglioneitalia #italianpavilion #padiglioneitalia2019 #biennalearte2019 #enricodavid #chiarafumai #lilianamoro #neithernor #thechallengetothelabyrinth @labiennale @dg_aap

Not far away from the sunlit ‚Äòpiazza‚Äô, #EnricoDavid‚Äôs creatures have been refraining from any engagement, reluctantly grouped in their hideout in the background. A crowded, barely accessible room where animosity has faded for good. There is no action, nor willingness for activism. They are uncomfortable, or perhaps resigned. They won‚Äôt sit at the table. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚ÄôTutto il resto spegnere II (Homage a E. F.)‚Äô is an archive of multi-headed creatures with the same features that, repeating themselves, form a multitude of identical faces. Closely packed twisted figures, reproduced asexually by mitosis: a legion of sisters, all daughters of the same mother. Hybrid, sometimes time-worn figures, armed with tools inaccessible to us, concealing secrets of extraordinary nature. They inhabit spatial and architectural motifs which include a triad of arches of different proportions and can be found repeated elsewhere in the exhibition‚Äîdesigned by Valerio Di Lucente @studio_julia. Surveilling the absorbed gazes, a clockwork mechanism: the effigy of Time advancing, or perhaps retreating. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

A day of spring, flowing into an endless summer. Wooden planks borrowed from the yards of builders far-away, colourful sunshades and chairs were placed to gather laughter and discussion. Then as brittle as it is in its character, the course of the season changed, as it has been doing since the dawn of time, and it became autumn, and then almost winter. ‚ÄòQuattro Stagioni‚Äô (Four Seasons) is a large-scale installation by #LilianaMoro symbolising social congregation and conviviality, the sharing of meals and story-telling, but also the idea of coming together to discuss political visions at the table‚Äîwhich here is flanked by four worn-out beach umbrellas, hinting at the cyclic succession of time, weather, life and historical events. While sitting in this square-like situation, the adventurous passersby will also hear a constant chanting. They are the determined, dreamy, angry and sometime sad voices collected by Liliana for her audio work in loop ‚Äò‚Ä¶‚Ä¶senza fine‚Äô. From a horn-shaped loudhailer, they are singing ‚ÄòBella Ciao‚Äô: the anthem of the partisan struggle against nazi-Fascism. The first version of the song dates back to 1906 in the paddy fields of rice near Vercelli, in Piedmont, Italy and it was sang by the seasonal workers called ‚Äúmondine‚Äù (rice-weeders). From the last stanza: ‚ÄúThis is the flower of the partisan, oh bella ciao, bella ciao, bella ciao, ciao, ciao, this is the flower of the partisan, who died for freedom‚Äù! ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Somewhere across space and time, in a surreal parallel universe of mirroring opposites, there lives #LilianaMoro‚Äôs ‚ÄòCapovolto‚Äô (Upside Down): a street lamp that neither illuminates nor leads the way but is contempt with floating above the ground instead, suspended a few inches away from rather earthly possibilities. Delicate yet authoritarian. Solitary but not isolated. An invitation to envision a different horizon, a new configuration, a source of light anew. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Final week! Don‚Äôt hesitate. If you are to accept the challenge, don‚Äôt lose the occasion to flip your universe over and upside down, with the lusciously patinated sculpture that is ‚ÄôCh√©ri (Mincer / Aratro)‚Äô by #EnricoDavid. A form gone through a series of evolutions, which changed its viewpoints from time to time although leaving each of them more or less incomplete. Once again an inversion: yet this time also in intentions. Born as a metaphorical system of connection and measuring of the whole Pavilion, halfway to completion the work has ended up suggesting other uses. It became a system of drainage. Wind chimes to blow thoughts away, or perhaps an articulated, rather than reticulated, dream-catcher. An ensemble of objects of barter, a piece of farm machinery, some tinny metallic tools intent in the execution of an archaic‚Äîor futuristic? process. Its body-not-body is a totemic and magical state of flux. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Times to wear my focus glasses, times for accounting and for drawing sums, times for conclusions and happy endings... ‚ûï‚ûñ‚ûó‚úñÔ∏è on @small_zine photographed by the talented @giovannamuzzisilva in her grandmother‚Äôs flat in Milan, dressed in @gucci. Words for the article are my own and speak of acrobatic convolutions, taking risks and the (fundamental) role of memory! 
Talking of remembrances, please SAVE THE DATE for #NeitherNor‚Äôs finissage this 23 November, 8 pm, Auditorium Santa Margherita, Dorsoduro 3689. We will premiere #AnnaFranceschini @a_cinema_verite_kind_of_girl short film ‚ÄòBustrofedico‚Äô specially commissioned by the Italian Pavillion at the 58th @labiennale and produced by @inbetweenartfilm and @gluck50_milano üé• followed by a performance by one of my favourite writers @isabella_santacroce üåπBut I shall go back to my balance sheets now before I run late‚Äîsee you next weekend Venice! #padiglioneitalia #italianpavilion #padiglioneitalia2019 #biennalearte2019 #enricodavid #chiarafumai #lilianamoro #neithernor #thechallengetothelabyrinth @labiennale @dg_aap

‚ÄòThe Return of the Invisible Woman‚Äô, also known as ‚ÄòVisites fantastiques de Vito Acconci au pays du fouet‚Äô, is a work #ChiaraFumai which holds its cradle in a secret room, accessible through heavy wooden doors. Making use of both embroidery and collage, the piece unfolds alongside the imaginary account of Vito Acconci‚Äôs last performance ‚ÄòBallroom‚Äô (1973). The narrator‚Äôs perspective is that of a presumedly female member of the audience who, excited by the artist‚Äôs self-mutilation, had interrupted the performance out of her desire for a relationship of ‚Äòdomination-submission‚Äô with him. The conversation between the two, inspired by the literary genre of BDSM (Bondage, Discipline, Dominance and Submission, Sadomasochism), is embroidered on the pages of Leopold von Sacher-Masoch‚Äôs erotic novel Venus in Furs (1870). Like Ariadne‚Äôs thread, the words in cursive streak and seam one passage to the other, and can only be deciphered throughout the mirror installed just in front. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Like unexpected, peculiar clocks, materials can become trackers of time past through the marks of their own usage, consumption, erosion, or even the simple exposure to the surrounding environment. Orchestrated by #LilianaMoro in 1990 as the physical translation of an ideal landscape of the mind, ‚ÄòParadiso Artificiale‚Äô (Artificial Paradise) consists of a long wall of yellow foam rubber that fends off sound, light, dust and somehow time too. A series of padded surfaces unfolds along a corridor, tracing a pictureless area in which silence and stillness can only be but reflected by a mirror wall as long as the piece. Favouring the hidden yet sacred potential of absence, emptiness and void, a sense of eternity peacefully reigns, encouraging the leap of one‚Äôs imagination. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

Did you know the etymological root of the word MONSTER is the Latin ‚Äòmonstrum‚Äô, from its corresponding verb ‚Äòmonere‚Äô? It signifies ‚Äòprodigy‚Äô, ‚Äòextraordinary thing‚Äô but also ‚Äòwarning‚Äô, ‚Äòadmonition‚Äô. To warn, to advise, to stupefy.

While en recce throughout the Italian Pavilion you will encounter, set on the edges of the labyrinth near the main entrance, a pigmented and hairy statue of rubber and bronze. A work by #EnricoDavid, its name is ‚ÄòOstetricia‚Äô (Midwifery). A figure of ample proportions, a Junoesque column with slender profiles. Fiercely standing in an attitude of support of the surrounding walls, like a caryatid, it remains enigmatic, resembling a sphinx with multiple heads of hair. Is it there to cast a captatio benvolentiae, or a damnatio memoriae? Will you be spellbound, or forever estranged? Depending on the circumstances of your mutual encounter, this creature will open its arms to welcome you‚Ä¶ Or to bid you farewell! ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üì∏ @delfino_sl @_marcocappelletti ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

‚ÄòPortrait of Madame B.‚Äô is a collage by #ChiaraFumai portraying the theosophist, occultist and medium of Russian origin Madame Blavatsky (1831-91). Over the course of her career, Fumai created several works of performative ritual magic through the physical invocation of historical figures, for the most part women. These presences, which Chiara called ‚Äòsisters‚Äô, became part of her works, with an evocative effect that, in addition to letting her give them back their voice, provided her with an opportunity to pay tribute to them. Fumai perpetuated the ideas and existence of these authors through the insertion of fragments of their original texts in her scripts, or recounting them through images that evoked their appearance and their personality. In doing so, the artist allowed the past to seep into and disrupt the present, with this last understood as a set of historical as well as physical relations. #padiglioneitalia #italianpavilion #padiglioneitalia2019 #biennalearte2019 #enricodavid #chiarafumai #lilianamoro #neithernor #thechallengetothelabyrinth @labiennale @dg_aap
